item.description:
Shetland Sheep trace back at least 5,000 years in Shetland, an archipelago off mainland Scotland. They have naturally colorful fleece often described as the "lightest wool". Influence from Norse settlements in the Shetland Islands around 800 C.E. contributed to the knitting styles that come from that area: detailed lace patterns as well as intricate colorwork.

This fiber fact and many more to come.

Also we have a knit night coming up.
